dublinCore.dc:title: 119 S2069 IS: Stabilize Medicaid and CHIP Coverage Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Whitehouse (for himself, Mr. Wyden, Mr. Luján, Ms. Warren, Mr. Booker, Mrs. Gillibrand, Ms. Smith, Mr. Welch, and Ms. Alsobrooks) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend titles XIX and XXI of the Social Security Act to provide for 12-month continuous enrollment of individuals under the Medicaid program and Children’s Health Insurance Program.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stabilize Medicaid and CHIP Coverage Act.

section.header: Providing for 12-month continuous enrollment of individuals under the Medicaid program and Children’s Health Insurance Program

subsection.text: Section 1902(e)(12) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396a(e)(12)), as amended by section 5112 of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2023, is further amended—

paragraph.text: in the header, by striking for children;
in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking who is under the age of 19 and;
in subparagraph (A), by adding or at the end;

subsection.text: Section 2107(e)(1)(K) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1397gg(e)(1)(K)), as amended by section 5112 of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2023, is further amended—

paragraph.text: by striking a targeted low-income child and inserting an individual; and
by striking child becomes and inserting individual becomes.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall take effect on the first day of the first fiscal quarter that begins on or after December 31, 2026.
